Title: 13.3.4 The BLOB and TEXT Types
Description: A BLOB column with a maximum length of 255 (28 âˆ’ 1) bytes. Each TINYBLOB value is stored using a 1-byte length prefix that indicates the number of bytes in the value.
An optional length M can be given for this type. If this is done, MySQL creates the column as the smallest BLOB type large enough to hold values M bytes long.
